summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Offices and the U.S. Marshals Service regarding an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for a possible International Megan's Law (IML) violation. It details Epstein's unreported travel to Vienna, Austria, and Morocco in March and April 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a U.S. Marshals Service investigation for failing to report international travel as required by the International Megan's Law (IML) sex offender registry.

persons.name: Ron De Lugo
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Virgin Islands, whose office is involved in the correspondence regarding the investigation.

connections.description: Epstein is under investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Virgin Islands, where Ron De Lugo is the U.S. Attorney.

events.title: Epstein signs IML travel form
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed the Virgin Islands sex offender registry 'Notification of Duty to Report Travel' form, acknowledging his obligation to report international travel.

events.title: Unreported travel to Vienna
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria, with three female passengers for coffee, and this travel was not reported as required by IML.

events.title: Unreported travel to Morocco
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Morocco, and this travel was not reported as required by IML.

locations: USVI (U.S. Virgin Islands) - Epstein's primary residence
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's primary residence was in the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI).
The U.S. Marshals Service was investigating Epstein for a possible International Megan's Law (IML) violation related to unreported international travel.
Epstein signed the required IML travel notification form on March 15, 2019, but then failed to report trips to Vienna, Austria (March 22, 2019) and Morocco (April 25, 2019).
The investigator expressed concern that public disclosure of this information could hamper the ongoing investigation, citing Epstein's resources.
The email correspondence involves the U.S. Attorney's Offices for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the Virgin Islands (USAVI), and the U.S. Marshals Service (USMS).
